intro: Malcolmia binervis proles confusa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf moonflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive two-veined pattern, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
